author: Imogen Neale
title: Thieves take antique church pews
text:
Thieves take antique church pews IMOGEN NEALE Last updated 15:18, February 22 2017 Police 
Thieves ripped the heavy, wooden pews from the church. 
Thieves have taken 10 heavy, wooden pews from a church in Auckland. 
Police say the "unusual theft" would have involved at least two people and a large vehicle or trailer. 
The pews were stolen in a break in at the Mt Eden Presbyterian Church at 31 Esplanade Road in Mt Eden on Sunday, February 12. SUPPLIED 
This is what the stolen pews look like. 
Two of the pews are eight metres in length and eight of them are three metres long. They are wooden and over 117 years old. 
The pews may have had distinctive numbering inscribed into the ends. 
Constable Laura Van Doormaal said the pews were large and distinctive and would have been difficult to transport. SUPPLIED 
The pews were taken from Mt Eden Presbyterian Church. 
"It would take at least two people and a large vehicle or trailer to remove them. We appeal to anyone who may have a seen a large vehicle or trailer in the church grounds or carpark to contact us," she said. 
"This is certainly an unusual theft and anyone who is offered one of these for sale might not even consider it is stolen." 
Police asked anyone who saw any suspicious behaviour in the area between Sunday, February 12, and Friday, February 17, to contact Constable Laura van Doormaal on 021 908 551 or email . 
Information can also be provided anonymously to the organisation Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111.
